pr_title: Enhance Envoy metrics service analyzer by MAL

timeline.message: Enhance Envoy metrics service analyzer by MAL
Enhance Envoy metrics service analyzer by MAL

timeline.bodyText: Envoy now doesn't have a latest tag, and pinning the image version is a good practice IMO.
timeline.author: kezhenxu94
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@
 version: "3"
 services:
   envoy:
-    image: envoyproxy/envoy-alpine:latest
+    image: envoyproxy/envoy-alpine:v1.16.2

timeline.bodyText: Metrics names in Envoy contain ., hence this is necessary
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

timeline.bodyText: Does this make sense @hanahmily ? Seems both control plane and data plane all share the same "serviceGroup" in "oap-server/server-bootstrap/src/main/resources/ui-initialized-templates/istio.yml"
timeline.author: kezhenxu94
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -28,7 +28,7 @@ # "-P6H3M" -- parses as "-6 hours and -3 minutes" # "-P-6H+3M" -- parses as "+6 hours and -3 minutes" # -expSuffix: tag({tags -> tags.cluster = 'istio-ctrl::' + tags.cluster}).service(['cluster', 'app'])

replies.bodyText: This rule file intends to ingest metrics from different Kubernetes clusters, not identify control plane and data plane. There might be more than one cluster when two different OT collectors transfer metrics to the OAP cluster.
replies.author: hanahmily

timeline.message: Make the original tests pass first

timeline.bodyText: Why need this? Could we disable through SW_ENVOY_METRIC=-?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Why need this? Could we disable through SW_ENVOY_METRIC=-?

We could disable through SW_ENVOY_METRIC=- but I thought this was not for disabling, it shares the same idea as #5853 , we may need this for the same reason as #5853 , do we?
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText:
What is this related to the #5853 ? Could you be more clear? That issue is asking for adding group for all services involved in the specific dashboard.
Such as envoy service should include a group name in name definition, then they wouldn't show up in other dashboard's service list.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: :( I pasted the wrong issue number, should be #5035 and #5530
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: I think this would be a little different actually. I can't see the chance of multiple rule config files in metric-receiver. All those two are only general receiver, you could have data from different sources.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText:
Such as this one should be same as ALS did. 
  
    
      skywalking/test/e2e/e2e-test/src/test/resources/expected/als/services.yml
    
    
        Lines 16 to 26
      in
      1b1f085
    
    
    
    

        
          
           services: 
        

        
          
             - key: not null 
        

        
          
               label: re(ratings.*) 
        

        
          
             - key: not null 
        

        
          
               label: re(reviews.*) 
        

        
          
             - key: not null 
        

        
          
               label: re(productpage.*) 
        

        
          
             - key: not null 
        

        
          
               label: re(details.*) 
        

        
          
             - key: not null 
        

        
          
               label: re(istio-ingressgateway.*) 
        
    
  


More importantly, the instance name should be pod's name.

replies.bodyText: I know. I just take an example, because we don't verify the instance name in the test. The point is, we need ALS and MetricsService analysis results share the same naming rule.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: This is the logic we used to do, but I think we should share the ALS logic. Then in future integration, the entity names of sidecar metrics will be as same as the traffic related metrics.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: The service names in metrics service have a service group prefix (istio-dp::) while those in ALS don't have, do we want to add service group in ALS as well?
replies.author: kezhenxu94

timeline.message:
Merge branch 'master' into envoy/mal

# Conflicts:
#	CHANGES.md
#	oap-server/server-receiver-plugin/envoy-metrics-receiver-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/envoy/EnvoyMetricReceiverProvider.java
Unify the Service & ServiceInstance names with ALS

timeline.bodyText: ServiceMetaInfoAdapter is for meta exchange only, right? Where is the ip-mapping mechanism?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: I assume meta-exchange is default ON by today's Istio, right? I think we need to disable it manually?
timeline.author: wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -129,3 +129,93 @@ jobs:
       - name: Clean up
         if: ${{ always() }}
         run: minikube delete
+
+  metrics-service:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-16.04
+    timeout-minutes: 60
+    name: MetricsService
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+
+      - name: Build Docker Image
+        run: make docker
+
+      - name: Prepare envrionment
+        run: bash ${SCRIPTS_DIR}/pre.sh
+
+      - name: Install Minikube
+        run: bash ${SCRIPTS_DIR}/minikube.sh start
+
+      - name: Install Istio
+        run: bash ${SCRIPTS_DIR}/istio.sh --set profile=demo --set meshConfig.defaultConfig.envoyMetricsService.address=skywalking-oap.istio-system:11800

timeline.bodyText: Pls add more unit tests to cover these functions
timeline.author: hanahmily

timeline.message: Address review comments, add tests, fix tests

timeline.bodyText: cc @hanahmily Due to share the same node id mechanism, even we don't require header exchange in the metrics service analysis. We will still depend on Istio control. We fetch the name based on that.
timeline.author: wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -39,6 +39,17 @@ A more complete static configuration, can be observed [here](config.yaml).
 
 Note that Envoy can also be configured dynamically through [xDS Protocol](https://github.com/envoyproxy/data-plane-api/blob/master/XDS_PROTOCOL.md).
 
+**Attention**: Only use this when Envoy is under Istio's control, because SkyWalking needs to parse the service name and service instance name from the metadata that is injected by Istio. However, if you want to use this without Istio, you need to inject the metadata yourself like this:
